articles.author: Tom Farren
articles.description: The size of the losses have sparked a joint investigation into Celsius’ demise by Canadian regulators and the SEC across the border.
articles.title: Canada's 2nd Largest Pension Fund Embroiled in Celsius Collapse

articles.description: The FTX CEO is brutally honest in his assessment of his Voyager deal, but added that he can only aim for "OK" rather than "amazing" bailout deals.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried: Voyager Deal Likely ‘$70M Down the Drain’

articles.description: The company aims to be the top provider of staking services and already considers it an “early win.”

articles.description: Cybercriminals made off with $570,000 in Ethereum, some of it since frozen, before a fix was announced.

articles.description: As the top Solana NFT marketplace pushes into Ethereum, it wants to build a trading platform for Bored Apes—with benefits for holders.

articles.description: Trading volume on the exchange fell by 29% in the second quarter.

articles.description: Circle insists it’s doing “the right thing,” advocating for the new chain's development amid growing discussions of yet another Ethereum fork.
articles.title: Circle's USDC Will Not Support an Ethereum Proof-of-Work Fork

articles.description: Tornado cash was banned yesterday. But now a naughty user is proving this ban may be difficult to enforce.

articles.description: Vitalik Buterin said the need for privacy from Russia’s government led him to use the Ethereum mixing protocol.
articles.title: Ethereum Cofounder Says He Used Now-Blacklisted Tornado Cash to Donate to Ukraine

articles.description: Amid an investigation into WazirX, Binance and its CEO have continued to distance the firm from the India-based crypto exchange.

articles.description: Arbitrum’s new gaming and social dapp-centric Nova chain is live, and Reddit could bring millions of users to it via rewards. FTX is also on board.

articles.description: The source code for crypto privacy mixer Tornado Cash has been removed from Github, prompting outcry from privacy and free speech advocates.
articles.title: 'It Doesn’t Change Anything' Says Tornado Cash After Code Disappears From GitHub

articles.description: A new proposal would see a new ERC-721 extension use stealth addresses to obscure NFT transactions on the Ethereum network.

articles.description: Bitcoin miner Marathon Digital increased its Bitcoin holdings by 707 despite a quarterly decline in production.

articles.description: Security and privacy experts say it's become alarmingly common for people to report vulnerabilities on public forums like Twitter because they otherwise get ignored.

articles.description: A new Ethereum fork resisting the upcoming merge doesn’t exist yet, but BitMEX wants to make sure the token has a market for speculators.

articles.description: Hodlnaut is the latest crypto lender to pause withdrawals in order to "stabilize liquidity" amidst the sector's ongoing insolvency troubles.

articles.title: Binance 'Never Completed' Acquisition of Troubled Crypto Exchange WazirX: CZ

articles.description: Popular Ethereum competitor Avalanche has gained double-digits as NFTs on the network gain traction.

articles.title: CFTC Targets Election Betting Platform PredictIt

articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Michael Saylor Leaves CEO Role to ‘Focus More on Bitcoin,’ Nomad and Solana Get Hacked

articles.description: The credit-based stablecoin was deployed to the Ethereum mainnet exactly one year ago today.
articles.title: Beanstalk Celebrates Anniversary With ‘Safe Replant and Unpause’ Months After $182M Exploit

articles.description: Elsewhere, the need to enact clearer crypto regulations bridges party divides in both the U.S. and in the U.K.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Companies Report Big Bitcoin Impairment Charges but Markets Mostly Shrug

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: An Aave governance proposal suggests removing Fantom integration amid so many recent DeFi bridge hacks. Is the multi-chain narrative sinking fast?
articles.title: Aave Proposal Would Cut Off Fantom Amid Security Fears

articles.author: Daniel Roberts
articles.description: Coinbase is in the SEC's crosshairs again. But unlike when it shuttered its Lend product almost one year ago, it can't back down this time.
articles.title: Who's Afraid of Gary Gensler? Coinbase Braces for a Fight

articles.description: Musician and NFT artist Jimmy Edgar is fully sold on NFT art, but not convinced yet on the uses of NFTs in the music world, he told Decrypt's Kate Irwin.
articles.title: Why Musician and NFT Artist Jimmy Edgar Remains Skeptical on Music NFTs

articles.description: Ava Labs President John Wu sits for an extensive chat about institutional interest in crypto and DeFi (it has "absolutely not waned") and use cases of Avalanche with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Avalanche House in Brooklyn on July 15, 2022.
articles.title: Avalanche's John Wu Talks Institutional Interest and Use Cases

articles.description:
In our latest Decrypt on the Street segment, reporter Sander Lutz investigates Chipotle’s recent crypto marketing campaign and talks to Chipotle customers about their sadness amid the crypto crash. 

Sander himself entered the contest hoping to get rich; instead he got a single cup of queso dip.
articles.title: Decrypt on the Street: Chipotle Says ‘Buy the Dip!’

articles.description: Decrypt's Jason Nelson reports from NFT Expoverse in LA with JP Bedoya, Chief Product Officer at Civic, the Web3 identity verification problem rolling out a new set of tools to keep people from spamming NFT drops to take advantage.
articles.title: How Civic Is Battling Web3 Bots and Spam: CPO JP Bedoya

articles.description: Art Blocks, the generative NFT series, exploded in popularity and price last fall. Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon (aka "Snowfro") talks to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves all about why the price surge actually hurt Art Blocks and the problem with NFT speculators, the debate over digital art vs. traditional art and his views on Bored Apes and CryptoPunks, how he got into NFTs after starting a physical tile business with his father, and why he thinks everyone's mortgage will eventually be stored on chain.
articles.title: gm: Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon is Finding the 'Soul' in Generative Art NFTs

articles.description: The former Amazon Studios exec and venture capitalist spoke with Decrypt’s Kate Irwin about how crypto fits into the metaverse at an event in Beverly Hills, California.
articles.title: Matthew Ball on the Role of Crypto and NFTs in the Metaverse

articles.description: In an extensive conversation with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott, Binance CEO CZ talks global and US regulation, Binance HQ locations, crypto bailouts and how he approaches deals, the sports marketing push by big crypto exchanges and why Binance went slower, and why he believes we live in a simulation.
articles.title: gm: Binance CEO CZ Talks Bailouts, Regulator Demands, and Simulation Theory
